title: ULA’s Atlas 5 rocket moved to launch pad with U.S. military missile warning satellite
summary: United Launch Alliance’s next Atlas 5 rocket rolled out to its launch pad Tuesday at Cape Canaveral for a fiery blastoff at dawn Thursday with a U.S. military missile warning satellite.

title: Biden to sign chips bill in a boost for satellite supply chains
summary: A bill that would give $52 billion in subsidies to U.S. chip makers promises to galvanize domestic production, although it will take time to alleviate a semiconductor shortage that has been delaying satellite projects.

title: Report: U.S. should push for global rules on space traffic management
summary: It's unclear how much longer industries and governments can continue to operate safely in space without globally coordinated traffic management, says a new report from the Atlantic Council

title: Why space debris keeps falling out of the sky—and will continue to do so
summary: "All spacefaring nations should follow established best practices."

title: NASA to Host Briefings, Interviews for Agency’s SpaceX Crew-5 Mission
summary: A pair of news conferences on Thursday, Aug. 4, at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston will highlight the agency’s SpaceX Crew-5 mission to the International Space Station.

title: Hyundai partners with research institutes to develop vehicle for lunar surface exploration
summary: The Korean carmaker and its sister company Kia Motors formed a consortium July 27 with six state-funded research institutes here to explore the concept of lunar exploration mobility and core technologies required.

title: NASA revises requirements for ISS private astronaut missions
summary: NASA is changing rules for future private astronaut missions to the International Space Station, including requiring such missions to be led by a former NASA astronaut.

title: Elon Musk sets expectations for SpaceX’s first orbital Starship launches
summary: CEO Elon Musk says that SpaceX’s first successful orbital Starship launch will “probably [occur] between 1 and 12 months from now,” revealing...

title: RS-25 delays impact Aerojet earnings
summary: Delays in starting production of RS-25 engines for NASA affected Aerojet Rocketdyne’s earnings in the second quarter, but the company expects to catch up on the program later this year.

title: Rocket Lab’s Electron to launch NROL-199 mission
summary: Rocket Lab is scheduled to launch the 29th Electron mission on August 2 at 05:00 UTC. NROL-199 will launch from Launch Complex-1B (LC-1B) at Rocket Lab’s launch facility on the Māhia Peninsula in New Zealand.
